metadata.description: Versatile form input component supporting all standard HTML input types (text, email, password, textarea, select, checkbox, radio) with comprehensive validation states, icon support, and WCAG AA accessibility compliance. Critical for email capture, contact forms, and lead generation.

features: Error state communication via aria-invalid and aria-describedby
Visible focus indicators with 3px outline and high contrast
Disabled and readonly states clearly communicated
Checkbox/radio with visually hidden but accessible native inputs
High contrast mode support with forced colors

mobileOptimizations: Proper keyboard type for email/tel/number inputs

performance.rendering: Static HTML with pure CSS styling

criticalFor: Hero email capture (60%+ of SaaS landing pages)
marketingContext.conversionImpact: Email capture is #1 conversion goal on marketing sites
bestPractices: Use placeholder text for format examples
Use success states to confirm valid input
Icons provide visual context (email icon, search icon)
Full width inputs on mobile for easier interaction

usageExamples.title: Hero Email Capture
usageExamples.description: Email input for above-the-fold lead capture
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'email', size: 'lg', placeholder: 'your@email.com', iconStart: emailIcon, ariaLabel: 'Email address', fullWidth: true }) }}

usageExamples.title: Contact Form Text Input
usageExamples.description: Text input with label for contact forms
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'text', placeholder: 'Enter your name', ariaLabel: 'Full name', required: true }) }}

usageExamples.title: Search Input
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'search', placeholder: 'Search...', iconStart: searchIcon, ariaLabel: 'Search' }) }}

usageExamples.title: Textarea for Message
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'textarea', placeholder: 'Your message', rows: 6, ariaLabel: 'Message', required: true }) }}

usageExamples.title: Select Dropdown
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'select', options: [{ value: '', label: 'Select country', disabled: true, selected: true }, { value: 'us', label: 'United States' }, { value: 'uk', label: 'United Kingdom' }], ariaLabel: 'Country' }) }}

usageExamples.title: Terms Checkbox
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'checkbox', name: 'terms', label: 'I agree to the terms and conditions', required: true }) }}

usageExamples.title: Radio Button Group
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'radio', name: 'plan', value: 'monthly', label: 'Monthly billing', checked: true }) }}

usageExamples.title: Error State
usageExamples.code: {{ input({ type: 'email', value: 'invalid-email', state: 'error', ariaDescribedBy: 'email-error', ariaLabel: 'Email address' }) }}

type.description: Input type - determines the input element rendered and its behavior

size.description: Visual size variant - sm (32px), md (44px - default), lg (56px)

name.description: Form field name attribute for form submission

id.description: Unique identifier for the input element. Auto-generated if not provided.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown when input is empty. Use for format examples.

disabled.description: Disabled state - input cannot be interacted with

readonly.description: Readonly state - input can be focused but not modified

state.description: Validation state - changes border color and adds ARIA attributes

iconStart.description: SVG icon content positioned at the start (left) of the input. Use for visual context (email icon, search icon, etc.).

iconEnd.description: SVG icon content positioned at the end (right) of the input. Use for actions (clear button, password visibility toggle, etc.).

fullWidth.description: Input spans full container width. Recommended for mobile forms.

rows.description: Number of visible rows for textarea (type='textarea' only). Minimum height is calculated from rows.

options.description: Array of options for select dropdown (type='select' only)

value.description: Option value submitted with the form

label.description: Option label displayed to the user

checked.description: Checked state for checkbox/radio (type='checkbox' or type='radio' only)

label.description: Label text for checkbox/radio (type='checkbox' or type='radio' only)

ariaLabel.description: Accessible label for screen readers. Required for inputs without visible labels.

ariaDescribedBy.description: ID of element describing the input (typically used for error messages). Connects input to error text for screen readers.

attributes.description: Additional HTML attributes passed directly to the input element
